byline.contributor: Edward Wong reported from Beijing, and Poypiti Amatatham from Bangkok. Yufan Huang contributed research from Beijing.
byline.original: By EDWARD WONG and POYPITI AMATATHAM

abstract: Thailand government ignores international warnings and sends 100 ethic Uighurs back to China, which they had fled to escape harsh treatment; United Nations officials condemns act as flagrant violation of international law.
lead_paragraph: The country acted despite international warnings that the Uighurs could face harsh treatment in China and pleas that they be allowed to resettle elsewhere.

headline.main: Ignoring Protests, Thailand Deports About 100 Uighurs Back to China
headline.print_headline: World Briefing | Asia; Thailand: Uighurs Sent to China

snippet: The country acted despite international warnings that the Uighurs could face harsh treatment in China and pleas that they be allowed to resettle elsewhere.

keywords.value: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
keywords.name: subject
